unnormalised: The Delhi govt. announced a new scholarship scheme for underprivileged students yesterday. Called the "Shiksha Uday" program, it aims to provide financial assistance of up to Rs. 50,000 per annum to students from families with an annual income below Rs. 2 lakh.
normalised: The Delhi government announced a new scholarship scheme for underprivileged students yesterday. Called the "Shiksha Uday" program, it aims to provide financial assistance of up to rupee fifty thousand per annum to students from families with an annual income below rupee two lakh.

unnormalised: This is a great initiative, bhai! Many students struggle to afford even basic school supplies, let alone tuition fees. The scheme will cover costs like textbooks, uniforms, and exam fees, which is a huge relief for parents. Registration starts from 15/07/2024 and the last date is 31/08/2024, so hurry up and apply!

unnormalised: According to officials, the "Shiksha Uday" program will initially benefit around 10,000 students across Delhi's govt. schools. There's a plan to expand it to include private schools as well, depending on the initial success. Applications can be submitted online through the Delhi Education Department website.

unnormalised: CM Arvind Kejriwal stated that education is the key to unlocking a brighter future for every child, regardless of their economic background. He hopes this scheme will encourage more students to stay in school and pursue higher education. The scheme details are available in all major newspapers from today!
